experience.responsibilities: I worked in a bakery, waking up early to decorate donuts and bake bread, amongst other goods.
We've completed two independent tours across 11 states. I design, develop, and maintain our website; built with Eleventy and hosted on Netlify via git.
I was responsible for cataloging our inventory of content and creative works to help the team quickly find assets. Additionally, I researched relevant topics for writing and publishing blogs.

I managed the email channel to drive conversions and engagement. I designed and built mobile-responsive promotional and transactional templates, implemented automated workflows, list management, and improved our HubSpot deliverability score from a 1 to a 67 (avg. score = 50), greatly improving effectiveness of the channel. I also headed SEO, which included maintaining our keyword database and Moz Pro reporting, identifying opportunities for optimized landing pages that greatly increased organic performance.

I conduct end-to-end testing for web-based products and promotions, while also ensuring best practices in performance and accessibility. I monitor the health of our domains, taking note of blacklisting reports. My work extends to the affiliate marketing team where I oversee compliance of our advertisers in accordance to guidelines. I stay up to date on the latest developments in the industry to help my teams be prepared for potential changes or optimization opportunities.

I design and develop websites in a WordPress multisite network for the college's arts department. I am the main maintainer of the network and have created custom child-themes and PHP templates to meet the requirements of each site. The site will be used by students and faculty alike, so I keep structured documentation in order for others who aren't myself to be able to complete their work as needed.

interests.blurb: When I'm not writing code, I'm either writing music or learning about literally anything new.
